page.title: 10MONTHLY MEETING HAUGHTON W.I
page.content: _______________________________ The meeting opened with the hymn 'Jerusalem', written by William Blake and sung to the tune of Sir C.H.H. Parry. After the minutes, several topics were discussed; a course of upholstery and lampshade making are to be run during the winter, theatre visits are planned - the Christmas pantomime especially seems very popular with two coaches already booked, the Domesday project was discussed together with the Christmas party and a shopping trip to Liverpool. It was also decided that the hand made blanket made recently by some of the ladies should be given to an elderly member. Tea and homemade bisuits were followed by a very enjoyable talk by Mr.Ellis on the Castles of Edward 1, illustrated by a slide show of his own photographs.
